meanings.definition: Serving or intended to regulate something
meanings.sent1: The regulatory body approved the new safety guidelines.
meanings.sent2: The company complied with all regulatory requirements.
meanings.sent3: The regulatory process may seem tedious, but it keeps us safe.
meanings.sent4: Her regulatory approach to time management was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The regulatory measures were put in place to ensure fairness for all.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the enforcement of rules or laws
meanings.sent1: The regulatory agency monitors compliance with environmental laws.
meanings.sent2: The regulatory framework aims to maintain order in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The regulatory officer's hat was comically oversized.
meanings.sent4: The regulatory power of the court was evident in its swift actions.
meanings.sent5: The regulatory guidelines were clear and easy to follow.

meanings.sent1: She regulatory the flow of information within the organization.
meanings.sent2: The board regulatory the budget to prevent overspending.
meanings.sent3: He regulatory the meeting with a firm hand and a smile.
meanings.sent4: The new software will regulatory the entire production process.
meanings.sent5: The team regulatory the project to ensure timely completion.
